name: qsv-python
description: Create a new computed column or filter rows by evaluating a Python expression on every row of a CSV file.

args.name: expression
args.description: Can either be a Python expression, or if it starts with "file:" or ends with ".py" - the filepath from which to load the Python expression. Note that argument expects a SINGLE expression, and not a full-blown Python script. Use the --helper option to load helper code that you can call from the expression.

options.description: The number of rows per batch to process before releasing memory and acquiring a new GILpool. Set to 0 to process the entire file in one batch.
The field delimiter for reading CSV data. Must be a single character. (default: ,)

File containing Python code that's loaded into the qsv_uh Python module. Functions with a return statement in the file can be called with the prefix "qsv_uh". The returned value is used in the map or filter operation.
When set, the first row will not be interpreted as headers. Namely, it will be sorted with the rest of the rows. Otherwise, the first row will always appear as the header row in the output.
Write output to <file> instead of stdout.
Show progress bars. Not valid for stdin.
